item.title: Using MCP Servers: From Quick Tools to Multi-Agent Systems
item.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers are a spec for exposing tools, models, or services to language models through a common interface. Think of them as smart adapters: they sit between a tool and the LLM, speaking a predictable protocol that lets the model interact with things like APIs, databases, and agents without needing to know... Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/mcp-servers-docker-toolkit-cagent-gateway/

item.title: Advanced fine-tuning techniques for multi-agent orchestration: Patterns from Amazon at scale
item.description: In this post, we show you how fine-tuning enabled a 33% reduction in dangerous medication errors (Amazon Pharmacy), engineering 80% human effort reduction (Amazon Global Engineering Services), and content quality assessments improving 77% to 96% accuracy (Amazon A+). This post details the techniques behind these outcomes: from foundational methods like Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) (instruction tuning), and Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO), to Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) for human alignment, to cutting-edge reasoning optimizations such as Grouped-based Reinforcement Learning from Policy Optimization (GRPO), Direct Advantage Policy Optimization (DAPO), and Group Sequence Policy Optimization (GSPO) purpose-built for agentic systems.

item.title: How Palo Alto Networks enhanced device security infra log analysis with Amazon Bedrock
item.description: Palo Alto Networks‚Äô Device Security team wanted to detect early warning signs of potential production issues to provide more time to SMEs to react to these emerging problems. In this post, we discuss how Amazon Bedrock, through Anthropic‚Äô s Claude Haiku model, and Amazon Titan Text Embeddings work together to automatically classify and analyze log data.

item.description: In this post, we explain how we overcame the limitations of single-agent AI systems through a human-centric approach, implemented structured outputs to significantly reduce hallucinations and built a scalable solution now positioned for expansion across the AMET QA team and later across other QA teams in International Emerging Stores and Payments (IESP) Org. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/how-the-amazon-amet-payments-team-accelerates-test-case-generation-with-strands-agents/

item.title: Build a generative AI-powered business reporting solution with Amazon Bedrock
item.description: This post introduces generative AI guided business reporting‚Äîwith a focus on writing achievements & challenges about your business‚Äîproviding a smart, practical solution that helps simplify and accelerate internal communication and reporting. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/build-a-generative-ai-powered-business-reporting-solution-with-amazon-bedrock/

item.title: Safeguard generative AI applications with Amazon Bedrock Guardrails
item.description: In this post, we demonstrate how you can address these challenges by adding centralized safeguards to a custom multi-provider generative AI gateway using Amazon Bedrock Guardrails. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/safeguard-generative-ai-applications-with-amazon-bedrock-guardrails/

item.title: Scale creative asset discovery with Amazon Nova Multimodal Embeddings unified vector search
item.description: In this post, we describe how you can use Amazon Nova Multimodal Embeddings to retrieve specific video segments. We also review a real-world use case in which Nova Multimodal Embeddings achieved a recall success rate of 96.7% and a high-precision recall of 73.3% (returning the target content in the top two results) when tested against a library of 170 gaming creative assets. The model also demonstrates strong cross-language capabilities with minimal performance degradation across multiple languages.

item.title: When programs assume that the system will never change, episode 4: Stealing strings
item.description: A customer had a program that automated a workflow, and one of the steps was to run a console program that came with Windows, and that console program printed a confirmation prompt "Are you sure (Y/N)?". They wanted to programmatically say Yes, but since the customer had employees around the world, they couldn't hard code the lette Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20260115-00/?p=111988

item.description: We use GenAI in every facet of technology now - internal knowledge bases, customer support systems, and code review bots, to name just a few use cases. And in nearly every one of these, someone eventually asks: What stops the model from returning something the user shouldn‚Äôt see?‚Äù This is a roadblock that companies building... Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/rag-permission-testing-testcontainers-spicedb/

item.title: OpenCode with Docker Model Runner for Private AI Coding
item.description: AI-powered coding assistants are becoming a core part of modern development workflows. At the same time, many teams are increasingly concerned about where their code goes, how it‚Äôs processed, and who has access to it. By combining OpenCode with Docker Model Runner, you can build a powerful AI-assisted coding experience while keeping full control over...
